snippet: The Boston Globe won a Pulitzer on Monday for its reporting on the marathon bombing. The muted ceremony was also a celebration of the resiliency of New England’s largest paper.
abstract: Boston Globe cautiously celebrates its Pulitzer win for its reporting on city's marathon bombing in 2013; muted ceremony reflects broader mood in Globe's newsroom that, after years of layoffs, pay cuts and reduced coverage, staff can also celebrate resiliency of New England's largest paper; optimism is due to new owner, John W Henry, who has invested heavily in the Globe.
lead_paragraph: The Boston Globe won a Pulitzer on Monday for its reporting on the marathon bombing. The muted ceremony was also a celebration of the resiliency of New England’s largest paper.

headline.main: Fresh Off Pulitzer Win, The Globe Tentatively Toasts Its Future
headline.print_headline: Fresh Off Its Pulitzer Prize, The Boston Globe Tentatively Toasts Its Future
